channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes on a short stretch of road in desperate need of resurfcing, 17th February
item.description:
Heading towards Cheltenham, before the new housing estate being built, on a bend are ALOT of potholes making this stretch of road awfully dangerous to drive on as you can not avoid them. It’s a 50MPH road which you have to go as slow as 20MPH to avoid damaging your vehicle.Reported several times & nothing is done apart from emailing back “all repaired!!!”
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several holes along Marsland Rd between junctions of Seacomb Rd & Lewis Rd, 17th February
item.description:
As above. Several smaller holes and one large one near junction of Marsland Rd and Seacomb Rd
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Marsland Road, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The gutters and pavement are ankle deep in slushy leaves from autumn 23., 17th February
item.description:
They’ve never been cleaned in all this time. When wet they’re really slippery and dangerous. Sainsbury’s shop users frequent this route as well as many over 60’s walking from bungalows near by. We shouldn’t have to suffer this all winter long
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Barton Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain solid with silt, requires digging out, 17th February
item.description:
The drain is blocked with silt causing run off down the lane washing away the gravel infill that was installed into the gully by Gloucestershire Highways last year
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold

item.title: A very large pothole that has gotten worse over the past few weeks, it’s on the M5 travelling northbound right underneath the bridge of Lobleys Drive and before the exit for junction 11A. It’s in the left hand lane, 17th February
item.description:
A very large pothole forming in lane 1 of the M5 travelling northbound, right underneath the bridge of lobleys drive. Drivers seem to swerve into the middle lane at the last minute - this has been getting worse and worse for weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very uneven pavements all down whaddon road, 17th February
item.description:
All the pavements from the one stop shop either side of the road down to Cromwell Road are in a dreadful state. Some slaps are uneven and the paths are all uneven in general
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Severn Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Virtually every drain in cowley is blocked with mud., 17th February
item.description:
The drain opposite moles corner is totally blocked. The drain opposite Scrags folly is blocked. The drain outside The Cottage is blocked. I could go on!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is broken, causing water to run across the drive which is causing the drive and road to collapse, 17th February
item.description:
Drain outside WEST RIDGE, previously reported, status now says closed, however the problem is still there and getting worse on a daily basis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
